sentence.Network_en: The key issue was whether the four defendants acted dishonestly.

sentence.Network_en: If you can't get it honestly get it dishonestly.
sentence.Network_cn: 如果老老实实地弄不到,那就味着良心去弄.

sentence.Network_en: The Russians, badly led and dishonestly provided, were beaten on sea and land alike.

list.abs: 3."be on the fiddle"=be getting money dishonestly or illegally   非法获取金钱   They suspected he was on the fiddle all along.   他们怀疑他.

three persons were sentenced to three months imprisonment , suspended for one year , for dishonestly obtaining loans by furnishing false information to several financial companies .三名人士,向多间财务公司提供虚假资料骗取贷款,各被判入狱三个月,缓刑一年。

I fired that maid as she acted dishonestly ., 我辞退了女佣 , 因为她手脚不老实.

entry.def: If you say that a person or their behaviour is dishonest, you mean that they are not truthful or honest and that you cannot trust them.

example.ex: You have been dishonest with me...
It would be dishonest not to present the data as fairly as possible.
example.tran: 不把数据尽可能如实公开并非诚信之举。

means.word_mean: 1. in a corrupt and deceitful manner;

sentences.sentence: "he acted dishonestly when he gave the contract to his best friend"
